ai-iti108:0.3_0: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
ai-iti108:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti108:2.1_0: “Mendicants, those mendicants who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, frauds, insolent, and scattered: they are no mendicants of mine.
ai-iti108:2.2_0: They have left this teaching and training,
ai-iti108:2.2_1: They won’t achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training.
ai-iti108:2.3_0: But those mendicants who are genuine, not flatterers, wise, amenable, and serene: they are mendicants of mine.
ai-iti108:2.4_0: They haven’t left this teaching and training, and they do understand the teaching.
ai-iti108:2.4_1: They achieve growth, improvement, and maturity in this teaching and training.”
ai-iti108:3.1_0: “Those who are deceivers, stubborn, flatterers, and frauds,
ai-iti108:3.4_0: so taught by the Blessed One,
ai-iti108:4.3_0: these do grow in the teaching,
ai-iti108:4.4_0: on the teaching of the Buddha.
ai-iti108:5.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
